thread.title: Ladies 9 Hole Golf League help charities
thread.title_full: Ladies 9 Hole Golf League help charities

author: Trumbull Times
title: Ladies 9 Hole Golf League help charities
text:
By Trumbull Times on September 30, 2015 in Recreational Sports , Sports features · 0 Comments 
The Tashua Knolls Ladies Nine Hole League held its yearly Member-Member Tournament on Aug. 27. Donations by all players of personal care items were donated to Mercy Learning Center, Bridgeport. Charitable donations raised through Casino play were sent to Trumbull Food Pantry, Wounded Warriors and The Miklus Foundation at Tashua Knolls. 
In Flight One. the First low gross score was achieved by Anne O’Neill and Denise Voswinkel; Second low gross – Pat Brennan and Eileen Jesson; First low net – Peggy Gettig and Mary Ellen Baker; Second low net – Pat Kilton and Gail D’Elia. 
Flight Two winners: First low gross – Barbara Brennan and Ellen Humphrey; Second low gross – Lisa Laudano and Jeanne Hall. 
First low net – Sue Pfannkuch and Barbara Saunders; Second low net- Janet Melfi and Isabel Trudeau. 
Flight three winners: First low gross – Ginny Goin and Kathy May; Second low gross -Carol Bronz and Nancy Cetorelli; First low net – Liz Cook. Second low net – Betsy Ehrsam. 
Announcement was made of the Club Championship, which was played the first three weeks of August – Best 2 rounds of the three: 
Club Champion is Peggy Gettig, score 93. Flight 1 Champion Janet Tomchik – 94, Runner up Mary Lynne Larkin. Flight 2 Champion Judi Kelly – 108, Runner up Sue Pfannkuch. Flight 3 ChampionLiz Cook – 117, Runner up Carol Bronz. Related posts:
